page.title: 07FARMING,DUNVANT AREA.
page.content:
A few small farms remain in the area with the emphasis on milk production. Most of the farms were established in the seventeenth century and are mentioned in Cromwell's Survey of 1650.Some woodland and rough pasture are to be found on most.
{Killan Fawr Farm. }This is worthy of special note because of its links with the Norman period and, later, with the Knights of the Order of St. John who established a guesthouse for travellers on the site.
{Prior's Wood and Meadow. }Given to a party of monks by the Normans,the land has borne these names throughout the centuries and the links are further perpetuated by the naming of two local roads, Prior's Crescent and Prior's Way.
